file_content.text: Small hunter. Should not have come. Is only shame here, and death.
Nalen Raloch. He tracked and... captured. Used pain. Demanded answers of your old thing, your Fount of Rajivari.
Did Nalen hurt you? I can try to treat your injuries.
Are you alright?
Pain. What matter now?
Nalen is clever; any information could have given him an advantage.
I hope you didn't confess.
Is already too much lost.
Nalen Raloch will get what he deserves.
You will get revenge.
Was captured alive, small hunter. Is no greater dishonor. Means all my points forfeit. Lifetime's score, gone.
Without score, I am nothing. Scorekeeper turns face away.
You're still a person, Qyzen, whether you have a score or not.
You're not "nothing."
You said you get Jagganath points from hunting. You could start again.
Can't you get more points?
Small hunter. Do not understand.
Indulge your religious angst later. We have bigger problems.
We don't have time for this!
Yuon brought hope. She risked all to come, past Nalen's men; asked for last coordinate to Fount of Rajivari.
Gave hope but... strangeness to see her. Yuon's scent, all changed. Perhaps because--was strangeness.
Qyzen, Master Yuon has been at the Jedi Temple for hours. Nalen must have used some Force trick, to make you think he was Yuon.
Trickery, on dishonor? Masking as Yuon? I will track and punish for this!
Small hunter, Nalen has all coordinates. Fount of Rajivari is his to find.
He can find it. Whether he can enter safely, without the clues I've gathered, is another matter.
He doesn't know of the traps.
Then I shouldn't waste any time.
I can't let that happen.
Nalen will need more than the Fount of Rajivari when I catch up with him.
I'll still see him dead.
I will accompany, small hunter. To guide. And see Nalen Raloch dead.
Points are lost. Scorekeeper will not see. But perhaps is some good I can do.
Flesh Raiders are dead? Hmm. Strong, healthy--worth many Jagganath points.
But, hunted many Flesh Raiders coming here. So, shall allow you these points, small hunter. This time.
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean by "Jagganath points."
What "points"?
That's very... gracious of you.
Thank you. I think.
Whatever "points" you're talking about are mine.
I earn my own victories.
I see is no understanding. I will tell.
For us, hunt is life. To make honorable kills, earn "Jagganath points." All tallied by Scorekeeper.
Scorekeeper. She sees all. Greater score, more points--is greater standing in Scorekeeper's eyes. Greater glory.
So hunting is how you serve your goddess, this "Scorekeeper," and increase your status.
I see. You hunt for prestige.
Yes. Is not many Jedi who understand.
How many of these Jagganath points do you have?
What is your score, then?
Many. Score is no meaning to outsiders.
Killing animals to impress some invisible scorekeeper seems... odd.
What a strange religion.
Cannot see "Force" Yuon talks of. Cannot smell, or eat. But is real. Is so with Scorekeeper.
Enough talk; have Fount of Rajivari to find. This carving. Is any signs?
It's badly eroded. I can't see anything that might help us.
Nothing I can decipher.
Apparently not. Do you have any ideas?
I could use your help.
I won't know unless I have time to study it.
Don't rush me.
If you say. But--hmm.
Smell something... strange. Bones, there. All old. And all in pile. Is deliberate, but... not Flesh Raider way.
I should examine them. Maybe piling up the oldest bones is somehow significant to the Flesh Raiders.
It could be ritual behavior.
If you say. But have seen nowhere else.
It's a place to begin, at least.
I'll take a look.
Go soft, small hunter. Smell Flesh Raider... and smell not-Flesh Raider, too.
Why does it matter what Flesh Raiders do? We're looking for clues about Rajivari, or this hilt.
I don't care about bones.
Was scent, so I spoke. But do as pleases you.
Forge. Yuon has spoken of. Is maker of weapons, arms Jedi.
Hmm. No scent, no track. Nalen is not here, but should prepare. Perhaps is time enough to build your weapon.
This will require a lot of concentration. If you could look out for me....
Will you watch my back?
Shall do so.
Rajivari instructed me, I have the crystal... I think I'm ready.
I should begin.
Rajivari seemed confident, but this hilt is thousands of years old. It may not survive the process.
I hope this hilt is up to it.
Shall watch path, small hunter. None will interrupt your work.
Go. Make your weapon. You have earned.
